title: rustc panicked at 'Failed to extract DefId...' on incremental builds

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

I can't provide code to reproduce it because it's private code. The problem happens reproducibly every time but disappears after a `cargo clean`, so the problem is probably corrupted incremental build state. Because of that I also can't check with latest nightly because the problem doesn't happen then.

The code where it crashes according to the bottom of the backtrace (`#1 [typeck] type-checking ...::handle`) is a simple actix `Handler` trait impl in the following shape

```rust
impl Handler<...> for ... {
    type Result = ResponseActFuture<Self, ()>;

    fn handle(&mut self, _msg: ..., ctx: &mut Self::Context) -> Self::Result {
        let addr = ctx.address();
        let addr2 = self.addr2.clone(); // some other `WeakAddr`

        async move { (addr2, addr.send(...).await) }
            .in_current_span()
            .into_actor(self)
            .map(move |res, _self, _ctx| {
                if let (addr2, Ok(...)) = res {
                    if let Some(addr2) = addr2.upgrade() {
                        addr2.do_send(...);
                    }
                }
            })
            .boxed_local()
    }
}
```

The `evaluate_obligation` from the query stack is related to the `addr.send(...)` in the async block. It's trying to resolve whether `Self` handles the given message type.

### Meta
`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.63.0 (4b91a6ea7 2022-08-08)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 4b91a6ea7258a947e59c6522cd5898e7c0a6a88f
commit-date: 2022-08-08
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.63.0
LLVM version: 14.0.5
```

### Error output

```

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.63.0 (4b91a6ea7 2022-08-08) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C linker=/usr/bin/clang -C incremental -C link-arg=--ld-path=/usr/bin/mold

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
#0 [evaluate_obligation] evaluating trait selection obligation `actix::address::channel::AddressSender<...>: actix::address::channel::Sender<...>`
#1 [typeck] type-checking `...::handle`
#2 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies
#3 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate
end of query stack
```
